title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
While spaghetti cooks, chop guanciale and fry in a pan until crisp.
In a bowl, beat eggs with Pecorino Romano and black pepper.
Drain spaghetti, reserving some pasta water.
Toss spaghetti with the egg mixture and guanciale off the heat. Add a splash of pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately, topped with more cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken cooked in a smooth, buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through.
In a separate pot, saut√© onions and garlic, then add tomato puree and spices.
Simmer the sauce, then stir in heavy cream.
Add the cooked chicken and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Delicious tacos with seasoned ground beef, fresh vegetables, and a squeeze of lime.
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat.
Stir in taco seasoning and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Warm the taco shells according to package instructions.
Fill each taco shell with the seasoned beef.
Top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and other desired toppings.
Serve with salsa and sour cream.

title: Classic Pancakes
summary: Fluffy golden pancakes perfect for a classic breakfast.
instructions: In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until just combined. Do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges are dry.
Flip and cook until browned on the other side.
Serve warm with butter and maple syrup.
